metaTags.metaDescription: Cloudflare Connect is where our customers, executives and subject matter experts come to understand the future of Internet technology, learn from multiple parallel tracks with hands-in instruction and deep insights on how to better secure, accelerate your websites, apps and APIs.

relatedBlades.htmlContent:
Cloudflare Connect Sydney 2022 - FAQs

Back to Connect Sydney 2022 Hub

accordionElements.title: Will there be another Connect?

content.value: Yes. We have one more global Connect events scheduled for 2022:
San Francisco - October 18, 2022
Please visit
https://www.cloudflare.com/connect2022/
for more information.

accordionElements.title: Will Cloudflare training be offered? If so, how can I participate?

content.value: We are offering a Developer Workshop track, but no additional training will be offered at our 2022 programs.

accordionElements.title: Will the event be live streamed?

content.value: We will livestream the opening keynote only. Please register as a virtual attendee to access the live stream.

accordionElements.title: Will there be a lactation room?

content.value: We will have a lactation room available. Please visit the registration desk and they can direct you to the location.

accordionElements.title: Will there be reserved seating for sessions?

content.value: All sessions are on a first-come, first-served basis.

accordionElements.title: If I have other questions, whom should I contact?

content.value: Please email connectevent@cloudflare.com

accordionElements.title: What is the cost to attend Cloudflare Connect?

content.value: The cost to attend Cloudflare Connect Sydney is $299 per person.

accordionElements.title: Can I register a group under one registration?

content.value: Please email
connectevent@cloudflare.com
for group registrations.

accordionElements.title: I have food allergies/intolerances. How can I request special food options?

content.value: During the registration process for the in-person event, you will be asked for any food allergies/intolerances.

accordionElements.title: What methods of payment do you accept?

content.value: Registration must be paid by credit card.

accordionElements.title: If I can no longer attend, can I transfer my registration to my colleague?

content.value: Yes. Please email
connectevent@cloudflare.com
and we will be happy to assist you.

accordionElements.title: Are there special hotel rates?

content.value: We do not offer any special hotel rates.  Please check availability at the Sheraton Sydney Grand Hyde Park:
https://www.marriott.com/en-us/hotels/sydsi-sheraton-grand-sydney-hyde-park/overview/

accordionElements.title: What are the protocols for pre-event COVID-19 testing?

content.value: Although not mandatory, we would ask as a courtesy that attendees self-test for COVID-19 within 48 hours of the event. We do not require proof of a negative test to attend.

accordionElements.title: Will proof of vaccination be required to attend Connect?

content.value: Currently no. Cloudflare will follow country and local guidelines on proof of vaccination. This is subject to change based on updates from the state and local governments.

accordionElements.title: Will masks be required at Connect?

content.value: Currently no. Cloudflare will follow country and local guidelines for masking. Masking is encouraged for attendees who do not feel comfortable without one. We will also have masks available at registration.

accordionElements.title: What happens if someone tests positive for COVID-19 onsite?

content.value: As this is a one-day event, we will not be providing on-site testing.

accordionElements.title: What if I test positive after the event?

content.value: Although not mandatory, you can email
connectevent@cloudflare.com
to let them know you have tested positive.

accordionElements.title: What is the cancellation and refund policy?

content.value: If you cancel on or before August 29, we will offer a full refund.

accordionElements.title: What happens if Cloudflare cancels the in-person portion of the event?

content.value: Although we do not foresee this happening, if it does, Cloudflare will refund registration fees.

accordionElements.title: What is the code of conduct at Connect?

content.value: Cloudflare is dedicated to providing a safe conference experience for everyone. In the interest of fostering an open and welcoming environment, Cloudflare wants to create a harassment-free experience for everyone regardless of age, body size, disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity and expression, level of experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, or sexual identity and orientation.
Examples of behavior that contributes to creating a positive environment Include:
Using welcoming and inclusive language
Being respectful of differing viewpoints and experiences
Gracefully accepting constructive criticism
Focusing on what is best for the community
Examples of unacceptable behavior by participants include but are not limited to:

Verbal comments that reinforce social structures of domination related to gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, age, religion or any other aspect of personal identity.
Sexual images in public spaces
Deliberate intimidation, stalking, or following
Harassing photography or recording
Sustained disruption of talks or other events
Inappropriate physical contact
Unwelcome sexual attention
Advocating for, or encouraging, any of the above behavior
Enforcement of Code of Conduct
Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately to help ensure a safe environment for all.

Event organizers have the right to take any actions to keep the event a welcoming environment for all participants. This includes warning the offender or expulsion from the conference with no refund. We expect participants to follow these rules throughout all of Cloudflare Connect. We think everyone should follow these rules outside of our event as well!
Reporting to Cloudflare
If someone makes you or anyone else feel unsafe or unwelcome, please contact our events staff. Harassment and other code of conduct violations have no place in our event.
You can make a report by:
Emailing connectevent@cloudflare.com, which will be monitored all day.
Contacting a staff member, identified by STAFF shirts.

When taking a personal report, our staff will ensure you are safe and cannot be overheard. This process may involve other event staff to ensure your report is managed properly. Once safe, we will ask you to recount what happened. We know that it might be hard and upsetting, but we will try to be as supportive and respectful as possible. You are also welcome to bring someone to support you. The report will remain anonymous and you will not be asked to confront anyone.
Our team will be happy to assist you for the duration of the event. We value your attendance and safety is of utmost importance to us.
